content.question: If <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a positive real number and <math alttext="a, sub k, equals, k times the natural log of c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for what values of <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, if any, does the infinite series <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to infinity of, a, sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> converge?

choices.label: <math alttext="c is less than or equal to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> only
<math alttext="c is greater than or equal to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> only
There are no positive values of <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which the series converges.

topic.text: 10.1: (BC ONLY) Defining Convergent and Divergent Infinite Series

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
